description.narrative: The Mongolia Governance Assistance Project aims to assist the government in (1) improving the efficiency and effectiveness of governance processes in the management of public finances, (2) promoting transparency and accountability in the performance of public sector functions, and (3) fostering the investment climate in Mongolia. The project is designed around three main components with a small component on project coordination and management: Component A - Public Financial Management; Component B - Transparency and Accountability; Component C - Investment Climate and Component D - Project coordination and evaluation. Component A will strengthen fiduciary controls and ensure adequate and relevant disclosure of information for decision makers and the public at large. Component B will enhance transparency and disclosure in the public sector for engendering accountability. Component C will improve the investment climate and public-private interactions. Component D will provide timely and effective support to all project entities in the day to day management and implementation of project components.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article IV, para. 4.01 (a) | Description :The Recipient shall have established the Project Coordination Unitpursuant to provisions of paragraph 1 of Section I of Schedule 2to this Agreement. | Due Date :21-Sep-2006

Finance Agreement :Article IV, para. 4.01 (b) | Description :The Recipient shall have adopted the Project Financial Manual pursuantto paragraph B.1 of Section II of Schedule 2 to this Agreement. | Due Date :21-Sep-2006

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, para. 3 | Description :The Recipient shall by August 31, 2006, adopt and thereafter applyin the implementation manual, satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Aug-2006

title.narrative: Improved public accountability as evidenced by:(i) reduced perception of corruption and (ii) an effective conflict of interest framework that complies with UNCAC.

baseline.value: The perception of corruption is on the rise in Mongolia, as reflected in various studies and surveys (e.g. investment climateassessment (ICA),USAID corruption report, WBI indicators).

comment.narrative: The IAAC developed the Mongolian Corruption Index in 2009, based on quantitative (perception surveys) and qualitative indicatorstomonitor corruption. MCI is authorized in the Anti-corruption law and measured every 2 years. MCI is on scale of 0-1, with highernumber reflecting lower corruption

target.value: Reduction in 2 percentage points for each since base year (2010). Target achieved

comment.narrative: Reduced perception of corruption as measured by increase in the Mongolia Corruption Index

actual.value: i) The proportion of transactions (involvement to projects and programs, tender award, liability, settlement of claims, taxexemption, tax release) spent to corruption and bribery: 6.8% (Mongolia Corruption Index Report 2014) ii) The percentage ofbusinessman who reported paying bribes to public servants within the last twelve months: 13% (Mongolia Corruption Index Report2014)

comment.narrative: Small progress between 2011 and 2013 as measured by the MCI. The target of 0.8 was not achieved

title.narrative: Improvement in Public Access to Key Fiscal Information (PEFA PI-10).

baseline.value: Open Budget Index score of 18 in 2006

comment.narrative: The International Budget Partnership#s Open Budget Survey (OBI) assesses the availability and the comprehensiveness of budgetdocuments in each country based on expert opinion.

actual.value: Achieved. PEFA PI-10: Score of A

comment.narrative: Mongolia's OBI ranking fell in the 2012 survey and the target was not achieved

title.narrative: GFMIS rollout and better control over budget execution.

baseline.value: No comprehensive monitoring of debt situation

actual.value: Partially achieved. DMFAS upgrade from 5.2 to 6.0 completed; however, coverage of the system is not comprehensive as not alldomestic debt and external government guaranteed debt is recorded

title.narrative: Efficient operation of the Mining Registry and Cadastre system

baseline.value: No computerized cadastre system; management of mineral licenses arbitrary and non-transparent

target.value: Increased public access to the mining cadastre to further enhance transparency

actual.value: Achieved. Computerized Mining Cadastre System fully functional and used to record and manage all mineral licences. Information alsodisclosed to the public

title.narrative: Tax Administration Information System (TAIS) fully functional in two pilot sites

baseline.value: Multiple and inconsistent tax administration systems resulting in data errors, lack of transparency, and inefficiency in taxregistration, assessments, collections, and audits

target.value: Integrated Tax Administration Information System operationally accepted by the GDT and successfully deployed in two pilot sites

actual.value: Achieved. Integrated Tax Administration Information System operationally accepted by the GDT and successfully deployed in two pilotsites

title.narrative: Improved and expanded disclosure of key GDNT data.

baseline.value: GDNT publishes taxpayer assistance information and information about rulings, taxes and guidelines.

target.value: GDNT publishes and disseminates (i) taxpayer assistance information; (ii) customer satisfaction and (iii) comprehensive statementof taxpayers'rights.

actual.value: Achieved. GDT publishes tax legislation, taxpayer rights, and performance information of GDT on its website

title.narrative: LSMS data readily available to the Public.

baseline.value: LSMS data is accessible in theory but access is difficult in practice and not advertised.

target.value: LSMS data readily available to the public

actual.value: Achieved. Micro data from all surveys conducted by the National Statistics Office publically available on NSO website

title.narrative: Functional system of income and asset declaration and disclosure.

target.value: Detailed assets and income declarations continue to be published. Improved analysis of IAD through functional Asset and IncomeDeclaration Information System

actual.value: Achieved. Assets and income of all public officials submitted and disclosed through on-line Personal Income and Assets DisclosureInformation System (PIADIS)

comment.narrative: 100% compliance and new online system functional.

title.narrative: Improved investment climate as evidenced by increased use of open competition in public procurement.

baseline.value: Sound legal framework. 2006 Procurement Law based on international best practiceWeak Procurement Monitoring System.

target.value: Use of open competition for over 90% of procurement by value

comment.narrative: Significant increase in use of direct contracting for procurements financed by Chinggis bond proceeds

title.narrative: Improved efficiency and effectiveness of management of public finance framework as evidenced by more efficient monitoring of the debt situation based on the adoption of the debt strategy.

baseline.value: There is no formal Strategy for Debt Management in place and no comprehensive monitoring of debt situation.

target.value: A Public Debt Strategy (PDS) is developed; adopted and used as a critical tool for Govt. to make sound fiscal policy decision. Acomprehensivemonitoring of the debt mgt to ensure sustainability.

comment.narrative: End target will be the effective implementation of the Debt management strategy (2012-2014)

actual.value: Partially achieved. MTDMS prepared and annually updated, but not fully implemented. DMFAS 6.0 enables partial monitoring ofexternal and domestic debt

comment.narrative: First medium-term debt management strategy/MTDMS for2007-2009 developed and adopted by Finance minister order #144 which dated onMay 24, 2007. The strategy has been revised in every two years as set forth in the law of Mongolia and the MTDMS for 2010-2012 hasbeen adopted by Finance Minister order #219 dated on October 01, 2010 and the MTDMS for 2012-2014 adopted by Finance Minister order#26 dated on January 20, 2012. However, implementation is weak as the Chinggis bond was floated without reference to the MTDMS.
